intro: Kedrostis digitata var. major, commonly known as the giant African spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and yellowish-green sap. The plant is native to tropical Africa and thrives in warm, arid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, which are modified leaf-like structures. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and resilience to harsh conditions.
